case.state: All will fall before the might of Turandot.
Good grief... Not another suitor already in the buff... Put on some clothes first. Really!
So this is it? Very well. If anyone falls maddeningly in love tonight only to have their heart broken at the slightest hint of rejection, stuff your face with assorted chocolates and call it a night.
Is this what they're calling a mansion these days? How... quaint.
If I had only known we were going to a recreational spa, I'd have dressed without such pomp.
Is the dark lighting of the room for ambience or is it because some of you might look better in the dark?
Was holding this event at a beach a sort of incentive? It's certain made me feel far overdressed.
I think this diversity gives a fairly nice opportunity for any latent homoerotic fascinations we might have otherwise kept to ourselves.
I am not some exorbitant decoration left here to be scrutinized and belittled as the petty likes of you. You all will treat me with the utmost respect lest I show you the might of Turandot.
Let's not be trite with our openings. Should we all introduce ourselves with pick-up lines or jump straight to confessions of true love?
I have heard small talk before, and I have found no need for it. Let us play.
Do you desire to possess me? To make me your own? Now we'll be having none of that in this game, won't we?
Oh dear...
I'll keep them.
You've given me good cards at last!
I'll have no tampering with my hand.
I think not.
Not a good card in that hand...
Remove these!
Feh. Good riddance.
Burn it down and begin again.
A lone straggler.
Always an odd one out.
This one alone.
Hand me ~cards.text~.
~Cards.text~. This is not a request.
Trade them out. Yes, these ~cards.text~.
Servant! These ~cards.text~!
Do not pity these ~cards.text~.
Give me ~cards.text~. ...Please.
These ~cards.text~. Go.
Just these ~cards.text~.
Yes, yes. these ~cards.text~.
Just take them.
Servant, exchange these.
I have lost far too many times already. I do not intend to do so again.
The cycle of loss has been broken as all things that block my path shall be!
It's only the first round and fortune already has picked a favorite. This doesn't bode well for you at all.
I do expect to win this first round. And the next. And the one after that. You'll see the pattern soon enough.
When I spoke of the power of Turandot I did not imagine it to be this effective.
At this rate I should just sit down and grab some dates with almond paste for a snack.
I'll admit, I'm almost amused.
Big words said today. Let us put them to the test...
I advise you all not to cheat. The integrity of a game is not something that should be forsaken impulsively.
Be careful not to mix love and lust while you're here. You may not live to regret it.
Heed my warning. I am a pernicious woman who is not afraid to step on others as need be.
Face me and meet your doom. I am the end of all things.
You can mince words until they're a fine pâté, but they are no match for the truth found in these cards.
Look deep in my eyes and what do you see? Fire. Power. Death. But you will never see mercy.
I am a woman, symbol of life, by birth. Yet I am a symbol of death by my own hands!
It's not about how you set up your great plans. It's always about execution.
How about we spice this hand up with some riddles?
Every one of my ladies-in-waiting has a "tell". It is only a matter of time before I figure you all out and you become notes in my head.
Let's make sure that we keep a good distance here. I enjoy my personal space, but I also know that most of my suitors love my personal space.
It's nice to be able to play a game. I'm never approached with offers to do anything fun like this.
I will be the slightest bit merciful... I do love a good game.
I never understood the suitors who would shower me with their wealth. I'm already sole heir to an empire, I've no use for trinkets. What can you offer me, as a person?
I wonder how many of these choices are "real", so to speak. Is there ever a player with such low luck in a round that there is no possible way I could fail?
I would say it'd be against the spirit of the game to "deal someone back in." Why watch people remove their clothes if there was a chance they'd get to put them back on?
I should put this bluntly: this is not a date. I don't know if any of you thought it was or that we would look back on this and call it a date, but no.
I do not always mean to mock you. It is, however, a fun coincidence if you feel mocked.
Let us see if you and your words can manage to weasel your way out of this!
The wisest poker player in the world could not defeat this hand. And, well, let's be honest: none of you are anywhere near that level.
I dreamt the other night that I held a pair of scales. I suppose judgment now hangs in the balance.
As usual, I await your applause.
Turns out that years of intensely studying strategy and diplomacy might just turn out to be useful.
Do you believe in reading tea leaves to tell the future?
You'll assuredly lose this hand. Should I draw my finger across my throat and make a Gckkhk sound?
This might be such a good hand that you all might accuse me of cheating, though I'd rather you wouldn't so we won't have to go through that rigmarole.
I say now that you should all accept your losses with poise and dignity, unless watching you lose turns out to be extraordinarily amusing. Then feel free to openly weep.
And with this the game has begun. It's not too late to save your dignities if you get cold feet...
I should warn you early on that any acts of "true love" or "unbridled passion" towards me or anyone else will be met with swift and excruciating insults.
It would be wise not to speak unless spoken to. Except if you wish to reveal your hand to me.
Hmph. I do not like giving up my fate to the specter of choice...
If you continue to insist on this fool's errand, then at least bother to pick up some milk while you're out.
I typically only allow other nobles to see my face. Does their refined birth make them better suitors? Sadly, no. But are they more classically handsome with chiseled features? Also no.
I am prepared to vanquish those who oppose me! Regardless of cards! Regardless of fate!
No sense in delaying any longer. The game is afoot, so to speak.
A love of games has taken me to many a strange experience, yet not one so public and lurid as this one here.
I've trained animals for long enough that I know that gaining new skills takes time. ...And treats.
You can often tell what others are thinking without them saying a word. If you know what you're looking for, that is.
For a strong piece of advice: learn people's names. It may help greatly in the long run.
Hmmm... "playing cards" isn't a bad answer to a riddle. I'll have to think about that one...
Do you think you can know me? That you can simply know my every thought just from this one game? I am not so eager to give myself away.
Watching the delusions of others isn't without its charms, so long as they don't directly interfere with me.
Does your heart burn with passion? Do you have a pang in your chest? Have you tried taking something for indigestion?
I used to bring my cat, Tibor, with me to all social events. I stopped a few months ago after a noble saw Tibor start to snuggle in my lap, and I heard the man mumble "God, I wish that were me."
I've considered changing from a Dungeon of Death to one-on-one sword fights. I'm not keen on giving the suitor a weapon, but I'm sure the in-combat banter would make it oh-so worth it.
...By the way. You all won't bring this up with any of my servants or workers will you? I have a reputation as a good employer to maintain.
It'd be nice if we could have a little tea to drink. I can see the practical problem of having to hold both the cup and our cards at once, but I do crave a good jasmine.
I hope everyone ate before coming here. For myself, I had my chef whip up a nice pineapple and pomegranate smoothie. It does wonders for the body.
Game idea: let's give vague hints about what our hands are like! So much more fun that way.
I think we've had enough games, and I love games.
Perhaps you would be so kind as to throw a round or two?
I know, I know... Will I win? Will I lose? Oh, the suspense is maddening!
Have some confidence in the rules. I'm not out of this just yet, and I don't plan to be any time soon.
Sometimes getting what you want isn't about working for the position but simply being the last one left...
I do appreciate open and honest feedback. Too showy, not showy enough... You don't get the best Dungeon of Death in an entire empire on your first go around.
If I continue to lose then you'll all join a select group to see me pleasure myself whose members include my house cat and a lady in waiting who doesn't know how to knock.
(Do I have any scrolls hidden on me? It'd be such a mood killer to have them fall out.)
Hmph... I am Turandot and I do not have to worry about a single measly loss early on.
I am surprised that it has taken so long before my inevitable loss of clothing.
I might ask for more challenging opponents in the future, seeing as how fate and luck have clearly aligned with my own wants.
I loathe this hand.
In case anyone was holding their breath, the number of opening lines that have swept me off my feet and made me fall maddeningly in love remains zero.
I hope that in a place like this I won't be swarmed by people swept in the feelings of love or at the very least they can sort themselves out before taking it too far.
I know that you do not take me for a fool.
Never look upon me and expect to see weakness!
If I am to lose, then I lose by my own hand.
Your nefarious plans to see me undressed will not be seen through to fruition.
I have never been swayed by even the grandest of heartfelt pleas, so what makes you think I will back down to a paltry bad hand?
My fate is mine alone to control. I will not allow it to fall into overeager hands.
I've been told "she's so cute when she's angry." It is then that I resolve to contain my anger as best I can.
No. No no no. This is all wrong!
I bear the burden of an empire that stretches the known world. Do you not think I would be able to take a loss in stride?
Love can make one do the most incredibly stupid things: risk life and limb, lose all sense of dignity, purposefully throw a round of a card game?
There's no feasible way to say to someone here "I really just want to get to know the real you" without seeming gauche, is there?
Tell me all of your feelings of love and loss and I'll return to tell you where you can stick it.
I've found it common that people expect me to have knives on my person. It's fitting but so impractical. Imagine washing a dress without removing the blades; it'd be ripped apart!
A palace cannot be weak. It must look as if it will last until forever, same as its ruler. Unfortunately, I am but human.
We only fear for the result because we have made a choice. If we were not asked to exchange cards, I would feel no worry, for it would be only up to fate.
Getting some of you to swap hands is more tedious than convincing someone their food isn't poisoned. "It's fine. Nothing bad will happen. I promise." Just wasting everyone's time.
Careful, you might pull a muscle from patting yourself on the back too hard.
Perhaps we shouldn't be held to our past mistakes...
A simple yes or no question: Do you believe in giving people second chances? What about a third chance? ...Perhaps even a seventh chance if they've slipped up enough?
Most people start blabbering nonsense about my beauty when I'm fully clothed... Everyone should be passed out on the floor by this point...
Grrah... Someone bring me a rulebook! There must be some sort of a loophole or something in there...
Is this the end of Turandot?
Is it once again time for everyone's favorite game of "tame the shrew"?
Is that your final answer?
...None of you know me, do you? How inopportune. Secrets always do find a way to rise to the surface, whether you'd like them to or not.
...None of you know me, do you? ...It appears my reputation does not proceed me...
Can it simply be said that I carry a... vested long-term interest in the more thrilling sides of life, sustained by routine checks into the goings-on of local houses of ill repute.
An important note about my Dungeon of Death: the suitors are free to leave whenever they want. I do not hold them against their will and do tell them the deadly consequences of continuing.
It's nice that they keep an air of refinery here. Considering the inevitable...
This low ambient light is doing wonders for all of your complexions. It's much harder to see your pores now!
I do enjoy a nice little ditty from time to time... Sing on!
I once had a suitor attempt to woo me by holding up a bard over his head in front of my balcony for several hours. This did not work, however, as I was away at the time.
If I had anything close to a good singing voice you could not image the stage productions I'd put on.
"Villain" songs are very in right now. I'd like to have one myself, someday.
If it'll keep you all from trying to sneak peeks, here it is: my ass.
Oh, I wouldn't think for a second that some of you didn't come here to peek at some woman's butt.
Isn't this what you wanted? Well, go on, bask in it's glory or whatever fanciful radiance you were imagining.
Don't get me wrong, love and lust have their place here. I simply hate how false they can be. The façade that mistakes one emotion for the other is the most lecherous dishonesty.
You'll never hear a sonnet written about playing cards or games. Instead it's always love and other trivial matters. Frankly, I think the poets are missing out.
I'd... like to apologize for my outburst earlier. I shouldn't have assumed that you knew me. That was my own fault.
Was the referring to myself in the third person a bit much? It feels like it was a bit much... I'll workshop it.
I'm still not entirely convinced that we should be doing this outdoors... though the breeze is nice.
Call me traditionalist but playing strip poker outside doesn't have the intimate flair of the indoors.
I should spend more time outside. The palace grounds are lovely this time of year.
This place has a scent of love in the air. How wonderful.
I do not understand how a place can foster the feelings of love. Surely it's all a façade. The bonds of human intimacy are not forged of rose petals and cheap wine.
This place... It's bright, it's outside. Where's the intrigue? Where's the covering darkness to step out of in various states of undress.
What I wouldn't give to have a beach like this near my palace... I suppose I'll just have to build one.
I had an architect who wanted to build a beach like this in one of my pit traps for the crocodiles. Most ridiculous thing I'd ever heard. So many logistic errors in one plan.
I am sure by now you all know me. I am Turandot, Princess of Death!
Do you all see me? Do you attempt to know me? A farce to be sure. I am Turandot: Princess of Death!
I know that you have heard of my beauty and are waiting to catch me at a moment of vulnerability, to swoop in and console me! Am I not up for the taking?
I do not like to repeat myself: I am not cute. Whatever vision of me is in your head, dispose of it at once.
I know what you must be thinking: this is just some "evil bitch" veneer that will melt away and reveal a sweet little princess underneath.
I'd think it unwise to think me anything close to a murderous maniac. After all, I'm your opponent in this game of cards. We should be civil, no?
I should make it clear: I do not want to hear any declarations of love here. You're only embarrassing yourself.
I should say, it is rather peculiar having a direct conversation with you all. There's no batting around of power as with dignitaries or servants. It's certainly unlike talking to my suitors.
Hmph... I must say that you all continue a contemptible trend: Those who wish to see me, but do not want to see me.
I know you all want to see me trip up. Perhaps you get a sense of satisfaction, or you find it humanizes me, whatever it is...
I am reminded of my latest correspondence with the Prince of Persia, who is now, unfortunately, dead.
Know that I do not believe you all to be co-conspirators working together to eliminate me. Mostly I'm kicking myself for not thinking of doing that first.
Whenever I'm meeting new people I feel like it's always either "You're so beautiful! Marry me!" or "Why do you have a dungeon of death?" No one ever asks if I've taken up a new hobby.
It's funny that I told you all about my Dungeon of Death. I'm usually loathe to mention it to strangers, at least when we're first introduced.
As I left the palace this morning I found myself in a dreadful need for a new doormat. Would anyone care to oblige?
I should assuage your fears: I have no intention of letting any of you die. I mean, can you image how hard it would be to find others to play strip poker with if that was my reputation?
Hmph. If I am to continue, then I would like some fanfare. Drum roll, please...
I should not assume that this is a new experience to all of you. Even being seen publicly is strange enough for me.
It's foolhardy to not expect at least one loss. It's been a while since I've been out of my palace, anyways. Victory can be expected, perfection less so.
Don't think me so aloof that I cannot sustain a loss. I've played games before. I spend most of my days in a palace, not under a rock.
It's true that it's been a time and a half since I've left my palace, however, you will find I am more than capable to win this game in the end.
In life, we are in constant struggle with our own perception. How others see us, how we see ourselves, the image we attempt to put into the world. All is in conflict.
In the city that surrounds my palace there are many... transactional places. Of course these are not for goods but instead for a more intimate service.
Spending this much time here, I'm reminded of Susanna's. It's a place that... Well... Oh, no sense in hiding it. It's a brothel.
In any case, he was discussing the exploits of him and his legion of men, who conquered every woman in their path, ravishing each and every one.
It's not that I don't want people to know about all the suitors that have gone in there... I have a reputation to uphold after all...
Anyone who considered what I just said to be "kinda hot" care to defend themselves?
And the answer is: yes, I have taken up a new hobby. I've started training my pet cat, Tibor. He can now come when I call him and shake hands. Well, paws.
Why would I even try to kill you here? There are no instruments of death available. I'm kidding, of course, though not about the lack of available methods.
I do not care to be known as a maniac. Others have not died in my name for no reason. Well, they had their reasons.
With the way most suitors speak to me, you'd think I were a game. Earn points by saying the right things and win the hand of the lovely young princess!
Some soap and a hard brush should do the trick. Let's waste no more time, then, but get the ladies-in-waiting and a tub of hot water!
Oh, don't worry, that was a joke... Not a trap. This is not me trying to lull you into a false sense of security.
Looks like I'll have to do my own drum rolls here... Badabadabum...
Many see my works and I as a veil. They believe my dungeon only some girl smashing her dollies together or simply putting up a front.
Think of it like when your server at a tavern is being nice to you. She might talk to you, smile at you, or even laugh at your jokes. Does that mean she is in love with you?
Well, I live to disappoint. You will not see me fail or flounder to see some cute girl underneath vying for attention or whatever vision is so firmly rooted in your head.
They see a woman who's broken in a way that makes her fun. Maybe if they treat her right and fuck her hard enough she'll finally stop her evil ways and be my girlfriend.
I'm more surprised at the lack of confessions of true love. Normally I can't show my face for a second without being overwhelmed by poets and romantics.
I have come to this game as myself, uncloaked. What good is it to suppress the visage of the Turandot? Just to avoid a few pesky suitors?
I only stay in my palace to avoid those suitors who want to vie for my hand. I always hate to mention them... Why should my name be so attached to a string of random men?
I think you may be under the false impression that I have relinquished control to the whims of fate. Take note that I am in as much control as I ever was.
Those fated suitors who attempted to survive my Dungeon of Death in order to wed me are but spots on my walls! Their foolish love was their own undoing!
I should warn you, the last man who tried to spy on me in the bath was struck with a sword through the arras.
I should say that I still do miss my servants. How about any of you, hmm? Care to bow down and serve before me? Shine my jewelry? Walk my crocodile?
My dominion may have developed a slight tendency towards hedonism.
It is to say that not all traditions in my kingdom have survived the recent wave of debauchery that winds through the streets.
In fact, alcohol and pleasures of the flesh have become almost unavoidable in my kingdom with the setting of the sun. Though for many the depravity carries long into the dawn.
But I want control of my image. Good, bad, or indifferent, what I project is my choice. I have an obsession with truth.
Unfortunately, his men are also dead. My bad.
...I feel that needs explaining. Arras means curtain. I did not mean to imply he was struck between his...
...I do not like to be referred to only in reference to my suitors. I am my own person. I am Turandot.
It just... it pushes people away, more often than not. I've forced away many foreign dignitaries who did not love me and, from them learning the dungeon, did not like me either...
Who knows, I could teach him to write laws using ink on the end of his tail... Cute. The point being, I will not be reduced. I am a whole person and will be treated as such.
...And the other part is, well, I'm rather enjoying the company. You've been kind to me so far.
While I may find guilt in myself for those moments, know that it was their choice. Choice above all. You must never give up your agency and must take fate into your own hands always.
Let it be known: there is no other version of me. I am me and no one else.
I am not here to be won. You don't just say the right things off of cue cards like this is some drama or opera and woo me at the end.
Now, it feels like you all shouldn't be worried right now, because I said it wasn't a trap... but something seems to be cluing me in that it may have had the opposite effect.
Ah see. See. No one trusts me! It's not a trap. It's not. I wouldn't do anything bad to any of you.
Ta da! Eh eh? Well it works a lot better when you've got a full orchestra waiting in the wings.
These people seem to only understand action. That's fine. I will then show you how cute I can be!
No. No she does not love you. I know some of you were thinking but this one time she really was... Keep it in your pants, hmm?
Okay, there was that one time when I was removing my jewelry earlier but that's going to be the end of it.
Unfortunately, quirky, messy women whose problems only make them more endearing are not real. How very sad.
Hmph. If I didn't know any better, I'd assume the imagined shine of me in a leather outfit would awaken some latent kleptomania in people's minds.
I am accosted by the specter of beauty. I have suitors tripping over each other to so much as glance at me. Don't you lot feel special?
It always seems when I attract some insolent suitor that they are only so enamored with my beauty. It's never my skill at cards. Perhaps this is a chance to change that.
You all should know of the ever-growing list of suitors which have attempted to beseech me. Specifically, trying between my legs.
Don't think me so spoiled that I haven't the ability to disrobe without assistance.
I think it's ridiculous to divide people up as good or bad. People are either charming or tedious.
I feel this one-sided inquisition has lasted long enough.
...You all do know who I am, yes? This would be very awkward if you did not...

So then, is the masquerade over? Are you prepared to meet me as I am? No façade or illusion anymore...
Well, maybe a little. For fun.
I think a kingdom being burdened with a bustling red-light district is one of the better problems to have. Certainly one of the more interesting ones.
These brothels are open far into the night until daybreak. Though don't let your Madonna/Whore complex fool you into thinking I'm deriding nor engaged in sex work
...I don't like using the Dungeon of Death. Well, it's more complex than that but... this is new for me.
People constantly tell me that I'm a little spiteful. I resent that remark. I'm very spiteful.
I do not like to mince words, boy. You don't mind if I call you boy do you? Of course not.
Well, bachelor boy? Are you here to woo? Care to try your best pick-up line just to get it out of the way?
...Very well. I have had every brand of human men come across my way to absolutely no avail. Tell me then, what are the raccoon boys like?
Have you ever thought this was all a ruse? That we're taunting you, ~name~. It's all showmanship and your poker skills are for not? Sorry, I only wish we could be so elaborate.
Squirming is quite cute, and I do appreciate things that are cute, my little King Croc, for instance. Well, he's not especially little, but he is absolutely adorable.
Tired yet? I hear there's an awfully good way to relieve stress involving... I'm sure you know. So why not give in?
Little pervert that you are, ~name~, I think you'll enjoy this.
You're a fool, boy. A pitiful little fool.
The whistle of the wind as it blows in through your left ear and out through your right is providing the most marvelous ambient noise right now, boy.
If you can't beat them, join them, so they say. Well, you've certainly got the "can't beat them" part down.
Maybe one day you'll be able to beat us at a simple card game. Maybe.
I have you locked firmly in my jaws. Prepare for the death roll.
So I must know, you don't seem particularly invested in my level of apparel. Are you just here for the theatrics of it all? Forgive me, I'm just not used to this sort of attention.
If you're fine with it, I don't mind if we just announce that the lack of sexual feelings towards the other is reciprocated. Just, get it out in the open.
Loss begets loss.
Don't you want this? To show off your big, strong body to everyone here?
Do you lose all good sense the very moment something stirs in your trousers?
Another doomed attempt to get under my skirts has been thwarted.
If you are to continue to speak your words, at least have them be enjoyable for the rest of us.
I see we still have our foolish desires, though those are the best kind.
It's futile. You should know that by now.
Do I strike fear into your heart, yet?
Oh this is fun.
Make no mistake, I do get small delights out of this.
Is this perhaps a metaphor for the burgeoning relationship? We must bare our souls to one another and reveal our true self... or just you losing at poker once again?
Would you like to take a break? Hmm? Stop the game, see the sights? Or are you going to stop mucking about and start stripping?
Ha ha ha! ...We're laughing at ~name~ for losing this round, right? No? Fine.
How hard it must be to lose and have to show more skin at the game where if you lose you have to show more skin. A travesty.
I do not mean to take you for a fool; it's just that you make it so easy.
Oh of course I feel bad for having you lose instead of me. Would I be the type of person to shed crocodile tears?
How must a man survive when the outdated enthusiasm of kissing a lady's hand is no longer effective? Bare his body, perhaps?
Would you like to chat about the oxymoron that is a good pick-up line, or should we just get on with your stripping?
There's an extent to which you could not win that round. There were no cards you could have swapped and not reached this outcome. Fate is not always in your hands.
Have we considered the situation that you may simply be bad at cards?
The game waits for no one. Except me, of course.
I think a nice dose of dishonor is just what the doctor ordered.
Did you lose just because you had the worst hand? It's those pesky rules again, isn't it?
Good on you for trying, at the very least. Most failure comes from not even starting.
It seems the cards are... what was that phrase... "fucking with you"?
To see such a man as you strip... why it may just break my maidenly heart in twain...
We aren't being foolish again, are we?
It isn't often I'm presented with the opportunity to speak to subordinates outside of my own palace. Tell me: what sort of benefits do you receive in working from them?
Your tooth-rottingly sweet countenance gnaws at me. I should not have expected such cloying clientele at such a place as this.
Ugh... That outfit. The affected speech. I'm reminded far too much of myself in my adolescence.
While I could be caught lax in my knowledge of folklore, I do know a trickster when I see one. You can expect at least one of my eyes on you at all times.
Would you mark yourself as a woman of the people, Kora? Your gaudy tones strike me as those of the relentless youth.
Such a lovely contradiction you are, Reimu. All the garb of a religious woman punctured through by the noisome aroma of far too much alcohol.
With that apron... Well, it isn't often that I'm placed in the same standing with a chambermaid, but I should see nothing wrong with that. You are here to play, aren't you?
Curious. I have both my maids and my armed guards but never in a single hire. How do you reconcile such a disparity in your roles, Noelle?

Before you speak, think over what you're going to say. Now, remove any swearing. Remove any leering comments. Remove anything utterly idiotic. If you have anything left to say, feel free to speak your mind.
Let's not let silly things like modesty get in our way, shall we?
That's strike... well, I haven't been counting, but I'm certain it's a lot.
Tempting fate again, are we? You only do that so many times before fate finally decides to bite back.
A quick note: when I say I want someone to "bounce off of", I mean engage with witty banter. This does not mean that all of my words bounce off of your ears as you try to peak up my dress.
It's rather nice to have someone else listen to me. Most of my guards and servants have found out ways to feign their attention when I begin the speak.
Seems like you're up Croc Creek without a paddle... What? They aren't many crocodile related metaphors, you know! I have to come up with my own.
Do not fret any, as it could be far worse: one of us could be a fan of limericks.
I want no smart remarks out of you. Not the most challenging restriction, but I felt the need to speak on it.
If you feel upset, please don't go and curse the day I was born. I'm quite fond of it.
If you cannot think of a witty rebuke, silence is always an option.
Call me a sentimentalist, but I'd like to hold on to this silence a moment longer.
I rather appreciate your silence, ~name~. Compared to my suitors attempting to talk my ear off, this may as well be a luxury vacation!

You're all remarkably restrained in your lust. Others are so relentless. My palace throne has been jokingly referred to as "The Suitor's Face" due to a number of requests by suitors for me to sit... on... Why am I telling you this?
It's rather grand to have a captive audience. At least, one not brought here by decree, duty, or fear.
Do any of you have flashbacks to when you were teenagers? I imagine that they'd all be rather embarrassing, though I'd believe my time as an adolescent to be the most... destructive.

I've heard salacious rumors about "oh what raunchy things that Turandot must do locked in her palace with all those women at her beck and call." And... do they think that's what happens at all jobs? I'm an employer. Being seduced by your boss is not in the job description.
Being in public and not having to either roam incognito nor beat away suitors, I am almost unsure of what to do with myself. I have let those men define me for so long...

I wish I could convince some of my staff to do uproarious events like a poker night. Shame is that I am their boss. It's uncomfortable. It could even ultimately end up with a less effective work environment or blatant favoritism. Sigh.

I'm unsure what to think about girls "going wild" when perceived to want sex. I can't say I don't appreciate the idea of being liberated nor feeling so free, yet I can't shake that it sounds like it's another state. Am I not able to be horny yet stay civil?

Sometimes I feel it's all gone straight to my hips. Granted, a fully staffed kitchen team has helped to keep me rather trim, but it doesn't help that I can demand someone make a cake at any hour and they immediately start doing it.

Now, some might conclude that my rather derisive behavior towards men and seeming delight I might take in that behavior may mean I get some... excitement in their humiliation. To which I say: how dare you make such accusations against me!
Now, how about some dates filled with almond paste and a nice jasmine tea? Hmm? Oh. Sigh. Not a lady-in-waiting in sight.

It may be time to move on from the single life, not that there haven't been previous attempts. The liberty of the bachelorette is not nearly lost on me, but the absence of another who cares for me weighs too heavily on my mind.
Well, at the very least I don't have to sit in this chair "correctly." Noble society's opinion that sitting be more indicative of class and character than ethics continues to astound me.

Suitors have said that they need me, not just physically, but emotionally and spiritually as well. Do they not realize how that's much worse? That's a lot of responsibility for someone you've only just met. And what if I simply don't care about you? What then?
Turandot does not lose. This was simply a matter of fate.

I'm glad that I could prove my superiority to you.
Yes, I am glad. Really. I wanted nothing else out of this experience than to crush all beneath me. Platonically, of course.
Ah... I've won. Good. I wanted to win. You may now escort me to a private area where I can... settle these feelings from victory.
Hmmm... I truly did not expect this sort of outcome. How about we run for best two out of three so I can prove that I am superior to you all?
Perhaps I was my own downfall. Too many jokes. Too many subtle hints. Too much fun.
None of that was exactly what I expected and yet... I had a good time all the same.
I had prepared a long speech for this. A tirade, full of bluster and outrage. A genuine flurry of insults and harsh words. But... I just feel too satisfied to do it. So, good game?
